definition: to go for/to engage in/to undertake/to deal with/to handle/to do

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
to do research/to carry out research

sentences.english: Now she is a teacher of Diligent Education, teaching middle school students, mainly engaged in teaching English.
sentences.chinese: 现是用心教育中学部老师，主要从事英语的教学。

sentences.english: Nancy was working in the administration, too, on education.
sentences.chinese: 南希也在政府里从事教育方面的工作。

sentences.english: Wat is de functie van deze man?
sentences.chinese: 这个男人从事是什么职位？

sentences.english: They tell you about their daughter and what she is doing.
sentences.chinese: 他们跟你谈论自己的女儿，告诉你她现在从事的工作。

sentences.english: An enterprise as a legal person shall conduct operations within the range approved and registered.
sentences.chinese: 企业法人应当在核准登记的经营范围内从事经营。

sentences.english: It seems that you love doing black & white photography, Please explain why.
sentences.chinese: 看来你锺情于从事黑白摄影，请交代何解。

sentences.english: Our company is located in the beautiful coastal city of Dalian, is the professional construction machinery.
sentences.chinese: 我公司是从事建筑机械制造的专业公司。

sentences.english: RA says that she does database administration work.
sentences.chinese: RA说她正从事数据库管理工作。

sentences.english: Yuchang Zou has been engaged in cosmetic surgery for 19 years after his clinical graduation.
sentences.chinese: 临床本科毕业，从事美容外科工作19年。

sentences.english: After her acting career, Chen became a billionaire in the advertising business.
sentences.chinese: 结束演艺生涯后，陈晓旭从事广告业，身价过亿。

sentences.english: Ltd. is a company specializing in development, production and sales on audio equipment.
sentences.chinese: 公司主要从事专业音响器材的研制，生产及销售。

sentences.english: Before being engaged in movie business, his favorite was drama.
sentences.chinese: 在从事电影事业之前，黎民伟最喜爱的还是戏剧。

sentences.english: In 20 years, he is engaged in majority time party work works.
sentences.chinese: 二十年中，绝大部分时间他在从事党务工作。

sentences.english: Women of middle and lower classer have been laboring in different trades and seeking for economic independence.
sentences.chinese: 中下层女子从事各种行业的劳动，谋求经济自立。

sentences.english: I can't think of any activity I'd want to do forever.
sentences.chinese: 我想不出一样希望永远从事的活动。

sentences.english: But a definitive decision on the form of struggle to be pursued had not yet been made.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于所从事的斗争的明确方式还没有作出规定。

definition: to do research/to carry out research
to work/(of a machine) to operate/job/work/task/CL:個|个[ge4],份[fen4],項|项[xiang4]
to set foot in/to step into/to become involved for the first time
to engage in (business etc)/to run/to operate
hired (for employment)/invited (e.g. to lecture)/engaged (for a task)/(in olden times) betrothal gift from the groom's family
to hold an office or post
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
